wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the project overview section focused on the Banana Wedding digital invitation platform. Explain its purpose as a modern mobile wedding invitation creation platform, core value proposition, and key differentiators. Document the technology stack including Next.js 16, React 19, TypeScript, and Supabase integration. Describe the target audience (couples creating wedding invitations) and primary use cases. Include both conceptual overviews for beginners and technical highlights for experienced developers. Use terminology consistent with the codebase such as 'invitation builder', 'real-time customization', and 'mobile-first design'. Provide practical examples demonstrating the platform's capabilities including social sharing, theme customization, and guest management. Document the overall architecture approach emphasizing server components, real-time features, and responsive design patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Introduction
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the introduction section focused on the Banana Wedding digital invitation platform. Explain the platform's mission to revolutionize wedding invitation experiences through digital innovation. Document the problem it solves (traditional paper invitations, limited customization, complex coordination), the target audience (couples planning weddings, event coordinators), and the core value proposition (personalized mobile invitations, real-time collaboration, social sharing). Include the platform's unique features such as instant preview, theme customization, guest management, and mobile-first design. Provide context about the growing trend toward digital wedding invitations and the platform's position in this market. Use accessible language for newcomers while highlighting the technical sophistication for developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Builder Page Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the builder page architecture focused on the main invitation creation interface. Explain the page structure with sidebar editing area and mobile preview section. Document the dual-mode operation (edit/new) based on URL parameters, authentication guards, and session management. Detail the responsive design implementation with desktop and mobile preview modes. Include the floating action button for mobile preview access and sheet-based drawer system. Document the dynamic imports for performance optimization and suspense handling. Address the workspace layout with scroll areas, background patterns, and iPhone frame simulation. Explain the integration between header controls, save functionality, and real-time preview updates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Canvas Rendering Engine
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the InvitationCanvas rendering engine focused on the core canvas architecture and real-time rendering system. Explain how the canvas translates builder state into responsive mobile previews, including the memoization strategy and performance optimizations. Document the scroll management system, section-based rendering, and dynamic component loading with Next.js dynamic imports. Detail the canvas wrapper structure, style injection system using getFontStyle, and the relationship between theme properties and visual rendering. Include practical examples of canvas customization, performance considerations for large canvases, and debugging techniques for rendering issues. Address the integration with Zustand store for state synchronization and the handling of preview mode versus edit mode differences.

wiki_catalogs.name: OAuth Providers Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for OAuth providers configuration in the authentication system. Document the NextAuth.js configuration including Kakao and Naver OAuth providers setup. Explain client ID and secret configuration, callback URL handling, and scope permissions. Detail the provider-specific implementation differences and authentication flow variations. Include practical examples of adding new OAuth providers and customizing existing ones. Document error handling for OAuth failures, token refresh mechanisms, and provider-specific user data mapping. Address security considerations for OAuth implementation and best practices for production deployments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the database schema design focused on the core entities and relationships in the wedding invitation platform. Document the main tables including invitations, profiles, guests, approval_requests, and their field definitions, data types, and constraints. Explain the relational design patterns including foreign key relationships, primary keys, and indexes. Detail the purpose and structure of each table with practical examples of data insertion and retrieval patterns. Include schema diagrams showing table relationships and explain how the schema supports the application's core functionality. Document data validation rules, default values, and business logic constraints embedded in the schema.

wiki_catalogs.name: Admin Invitation Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the admin invitation management endpoints. Document the GET /api/admin/invitations endpoint for retrieving all invitations with filtering and pagination options. Detail the GET /api/admin/invitations/[id] endpoint for retrieving specific invitation details. Cover the PUT /api/admin/invitations/[id] endpoint for updating invitation status and admin notes. Include request/response schemas, authentication requirements using admin credentials, and authorization patterns. Document query parameters for filtering by status, date ranges, and creator. Provide examples of successful responses and common error scenarios. Address rate limiting, data validation rules, and audit logging for admin actions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Common Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the common component library focused on reusable UI elements used throughout the application. Document the Header component with navigation and branding, HeaderAction for interactive buttons, LoadingSpinner for async operations, and Icons system for consistent iconography. Explain the ResponsiveModal and ExampleSelectorModal implementations for dynamic content presentation. Detail the ImageUploader component for media handling and the EditorForm wrapper for form management. Include component APIs, prop interfaces, styling approaches, and usage patterns. Provide practical examples showing component integration, customization options, and responsive behavior across different screen sizes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Invitation Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the invitation service implementation. Thoroughly explain the invitation data management patterns, CRUD operations, and real-time synchronization mechanisms. Document the service methods for creating, updating, and retrieving invitation data structures. Include concrete examples of invitation creation workflows, data validation processes, and state management. Explain the integration with Supabase client for database operations and the use of server actions for secure mutations. Address invitation preview generation, template management, and guest invitation distribution. Document error handling strategies, transaction management, and performance optimization techniques. Provide guidelines for extending invitation functionality and maintaining data consistency across collaborative editing scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Form Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the form architecture focused on the EditorForm component structure and design patterns. Explain the component hierarchy, prop interfaces, and state management integration. Document the form container logic, section rendering mechanisms, and validation coordination. Detail the SCSS module structure, responsive design patterns, and accessibility compliance. Include examples of form initialization, state synchronization with the invitation store, and error boundary handling. Document the component lifecycle, performance optimizations, and memory management strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Store Architecture and Data Structure
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Zustand store architecture and InvitationData structure. Explain the comprehensive state shape including nested objects for groom/bride information, location settings, theme configuration, gallery management, and account details. Document the type-safe interface design with branded types, optional properties, and union types. Detail the INITIAL_STATE structure with default values, validation patterns, and initialization strategies. Include practical examples of state access patterns, type inference, and the InvitationData utility type. Explain the relationship between state structure and component requirements, including how complex nested objects are managed through dedicated setter functions.

wiki_catalogs.name: TextField Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the TextField component focused on text input handling and validation. Document the component's props including value, onChange, placeholder, label, and validation states. Explain the input validation patterns, error display mechanisms, and character counting features. Detail the styling system using SCSS modules, responsive design implementations, and mobile optimization strategies. Include examples of different input types (text, email, password), validation rules, and integration with form validation libraries. Document accessibility features including ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support. Address focus management, auto-completion handling, and cross-browser compatibility considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Main Screen View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the MainScreenView component focused on the primary invitation display area. Explain the complex layout system with 11 different screen layouts (classic, minimal, english, heart, korean, arch, oval, frame, fill, basic) and their specific rendering logic. Document the dual-mode image handling (fixed/auto aspect ratios), photo expansion effects, and background gradient overlays. Detail the typography system including responsive font scaling, connector symbols (&, , ring icon), and layout-specific styling. Include practical examples of custom date/place formatting, conditional rendering based on layout types, and the integration with theme colors and effects. Address performance optimizations for image loading, SVG icon rendering, and the responsive design patterns used across different screen sizes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Basic Information Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Basic Information Section component. Explain how this section captures essential wedding couple information including names, wedding date, and basic details. Document the form structure, input validation, and data binding patterns. Include examples of how the section integrates with the overall invitation builder and state management. Detail the component props, event handlers, and rendering logic. Address accessibility considerations and responsive design implementation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the getting started section focused on setting up the Banana Wedding development environment. Explain prerequisite requirements including Node.js 18.17+, supported package managers (npm, yarn, pnpm, bun), and operating system compatibility. Document the complete installation process from repository cloning to dependency installation. Detail environment variable configuration including .env.local setup for map API keys and other external service credentials. Provide step-by-step instructions for running the development server and accessing the application. Include troubleshooting guidance for common setup issues and verification steps to ensure proper installation. Address both local development setup and deployment preparation. Make content accessible to beginners while providing sufficient technical depth for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Key Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the key features section focused on the core functionality of the Banana Wedding platform. Document the invitation builder system with real-time customization capabilities, multi-section editing (basic info, dates, locations, galleries, themes), and instant preview functionality. Explain the social sharing features including KakaoTalk integration, Naver authentication, and mobile-optimized sharing. Detail the user management system with authentication, profile completion, guest management, and RSVP tracking. Cover the admin approval system for invitation quality control. Include the responsive design system that works seamlessly across devices. Provide concrete examples of each feature's capabilities and user workflows. Address how these features differentiate the platform from traditional invitation services.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the state management system focused on the Zustand store implementation. Explain the centralized state architecture with InvitationData structure, IndexedDB persistence, and URL-based mode differentiation. Document the store initialization patterns for edit and new modes, state synchronization with Supabase, and real-time data updates. Detail the subscription system for collaborative editing, optimistic updates, and conflict resolution. Include practical examples of state mutations, selector patterns with useShallow, and performance optimizations. Document the integration with URL parameters, session storage, and browser history management. Address state hydration, migration strategies, and debugging techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Section Views
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the section view system focused on individual component rendering within the invitation canvas. Explain how each section view (MainScreen, Greeting, Gallery, Calendar, Location, Accounts, Closing) processes its data and renders responsive layouts. Document the section-specific styling, animation handling through ScrollReveal, and integration with theme properties. Detail the prop interfaces for each section, conditional rendering logic, and fallback behaviors for missing data. Include practical examples of section customization, responsive design patterns, and accessibility considerations. Address the relationship between section views and their corresponding builder components, data flow patterns, and performance optimization techniques for complex sections like galleries and maps.

wiki_catalogs.name: Session Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for session management in the authentication system. Document the edge runtime authentication implementation using the auth() function wrapper. Explain session creation, validation, and destruction processes. Detail server-side session handling, cookie management, and session persistence strategies. Include practical examples of authentication guards, protected route implementation, and session state synchronization. Document the integration between NextAuth.js sessions and Supabase database for user data retrieval. Address session security measures including CSRF protection, session regeneration, and timeout handling. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common session-related issues and performance optimization techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Row Level Security (RLS)
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for Row Level Security (RLS) policies focused on data access control and security implementation. Document the RLS policies defined for each table including invitations, profiles, guests, and approval_requests. Explain the security policies that ensure users can only access their own data while admins have elevated permissions. Detail the policy conditions, row-level filtering logic, and how RLS integrates with NextAuth.js authentication. Include practical examples of policy enforcement, common access scenarios, and troubleshooting unauthorized access errors. Document the relationship between RLS policies and the application's authorization model.

wiki_catalogs.name: Approval Request Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the approval request management system. Document the POST /api/approval-requests endpoint for submitting new approval requests with invitation details and metadata. Detail the GET /api/approval-requests endpoint for retrieving pending approval requests with filtering options. Cover the PUT /api/approval-requests endpoint for processing approvals or rejections with admin decision handling. Include request schemas for approval data, response formats for pending requests, and notification triggers. Document the approval workflow states, rejection reasons, and automated email notifications. Provide examples of approval request creation, processing workflows, and error handling for invalid submissions. Address approval queue management and priority handling.

wiki_catalogs.name: Form Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the form component system focused on input controls and form management. Detail the FormPrimitives foundation and individual form components including TextField for text input, Checkbox for boolean selections, SwitchField for toggle controls, PhoneField for phone number formatting, DatePicker and TimePicker for date/time selection, SegmentedControl for grouped options, and ResponsiveSelect for dropdown menus. Document component validation patterns, accessibility features, error handling, and integration with form libraries. Include styling approaches, responsive behavior, and customization options. Provide examples of form composition patterns and best practices for user experience.

wiki_catalogs.name: Profile Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the profile service implementation. Thoroughly explain user profile management operations including profile creation, updates, and retrieval. Document the service methods for handling user authentication data, personal information management, and profile completion workflows. Include concrete examples of profile validation, OAuth integration, and user data synchronization. Explain the relationship between profiles and invitations, including ownership verification and permission management. Address profile image handling, data privacy considerations, and compliance with user data protection regulations. Document error handling strategies for profile operations, caching mechanisms, and performance optimization. Provide guidelines for extending profile functionality and maintaining user data integrity across authentication flows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Form Primitives
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the form primitives library focused on reusable input components. Document the base form primitives including TextField, TextArea, Checkbox, Switch, and Select components. Explain the input validation patterns, error messaging systems, and accessibility features. Detail the responsive design implementations, mobile optimization strategies, and cross-platform compatibility. Include examples of custom form controls, validation rules, and integration patterns. Document the component props, event handlers, and styling customization options. Address keyboard navigation, screen reader support, and form submission workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Persistence and Storage Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the IndexedDB persistence layer using idb-keyval integration. Explain the persist middleware configuration with custom JSON storage implementation, IndexedDB advantages over localStorage, and storage capacity considerations. Document the merge function strategy for handling schema evolution, backward compatibility, and data migration patterns. Detail the storage key naming convention, serialization/deserialization processes, and error handling mechanisms. Include practical examples of storage operations, debugging techniques, and performance optimization strategies. Address storage quotas, cleanup procedures, and data integrity validation.

wiki_catalogs.name: DatePicker Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the DatePicker component focused on date selection and calendar interaction. Document the component's props including value, onChange, minDate, maxDate, and locale settings. Explain the calendar interface implementation, date formatting patterns, and timezone handling. Detail the responsive calendar layout, mobile touch interactions, and keyboard navigation support. Include examples of date range selection, disabled dates handling, and custom date formatting. Document the integration with internationalization libraries, accessibility features including ARIA roles and screen reader announcements. Address browser compatibility, performance optimizations for large date ranges, and customization options for styling and behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Greeting View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the GreetingView component focused on the invitation greeting section rendering. Explain the rich text processing system, HTML content sanitization, and dynamic content injection. Document the responsive typography system, text formatting options, and integration with the invitation's theme colors. Detail the fallback mechanisms for empty content, accessibility considerations for screen readers, and the relationship with the builder's rich text editor. Include practical examples of greeting content processing, conditional rendering based on content presence, and the styling system using CSS modules and design tokens. Address performance considerations for HTML rendering and content optimization techniques.

wiki_catalogs.name: Date & Time Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Date & Time Section component. Explain the datetime picker implementation, timezone handling, and validation logic. Document the component's integration with date/time formatting utilities and how it affects the overall invitation display. Include examples of date range validation, time zone conversion, and user experience patterns. Detail the component's props interface, state management, and accessibility features.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the Banana Wedding system architecture. Describe the high-level design emphasizing Next.js 16 App Router architecture with server components prioritization. Document component hierarchy from root layout to individual sections, explaining the separation between server and client components. Explain technical decisions including direct database access patterns, server actions for mutations, and zero client fetching strategy. Include infrastructure requirements with Supabase backend, authentication flow, and real-time capabilities. Document system boundaries between frontend presentation layer, backend services, and database layer. Address cross-cutting concerns like state management with Zustand, performance optimization strategies, and responsive design implementation. Provide system context diagrams showing data flows between components and integration patterns with external services like Kakao Maps and Naver.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the technology stack section focused on the technical foundation of the Banana Wedding platform. Document the frontend stack including Next.js 16 with App Router, React 19, TypeScript for type safety, and SCSS for styling. Explain the backend integration with Supabase (PostgreSQL, Realtime, Storage), NextAuth.js for authentication, and Radix UI for accessible components. Detail the development tools including Vitest for testing, ESLint for code quality, and modern build configuration. Cover the deployment stack with PWA support, responsive design frameworks, and mobile optimization. Include version compatibility information, dependency relationships, and architectural decisions behind technology choices. Provide context for why each technology was selected and how they work together to deliver the platform's functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: Editor Form System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the editor form system focused on the section-based editing interface. Explain the form architecture with dynamic section rendering, validation patterns, and real-time feedback mechanisms. Document the form primitives including input components, select fields, date pickers, and rich text editors. Detail the form state management, error handling, and accessibility features. Include examples of form validation, conditional rendering, and dynamic field generation. Document the integration with the invitation store, form submission workflows, and collaborative editing features. Address responsive form layouts, mobile optimization, and user experience patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Mobile Simulation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the mobile simulation system focused on creating realistic mobile preview experiences. Explain the device frame rendering, responsive breakpoint handling, and scroll behavior simulation. Document the ScrollReveal animation system, font size controls for preview accessibility, and section header interactions. Detail the mobile-specific styling considerations, touch gesture simulation, and viewport emulation techniques. Include practical examples of mobile preview customization, performance optimization for mobile devices, and debugging mobile rendering issues. Address the integration with the builder interface, real-time preview updates, and user interaction patterns specific to mobile viewing.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Profile Synchronization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for user profile synchronization between OAuth providers and Supabase database. Document the profile creation process during first login, user data mapping from OAuth providers, and profile completion workflows. Explain the integration between NextAuth.js user sessions and Supabase profiles table. Detail the profile completion modal implementation and user onboarding flow. Include practical examples of profile update operations, data validation, and error handling. Document the relationship between OAuth user data and local profile records. Address data consistency strategies, profile synchronization triggers, and user data privacy considerations. Provide guidance on extending profile fields and customizing the profile completion process.

wiki_catalogs.name: Migration Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for migration management focused on database schema evolution and deployment processes. Document the migration system architecture including the sequential migration files and their purposes. Explain the migration workflow from development to production, including how migrations are applied and rolled back. Detail the migration naming conventions, version control practices, and rollback strategies. Include practical examples of creating new migrations, handling data backfill operations, and managing production deployments. Document the relationship between migrations and Supabase CLI commands, seed data management, and database initialization processes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Guest Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the guest management endpoints. Document the POST /api/guests endpoint for adding new guests to invitations with RSVP details and contact information. Detail the GET /api/guests endpoint for retrieving guest lists with filtering by invitation ID and RSVP status. Cover the PUT /api/guests endpoint for updating guest information and RSVP responses. Include request/response schemas for guest data, validation rules for email addresses and phone numbers, and bulk operations support. Document guest invitation workflows, confirmation emails, and automated reminders. Provide examples of guest registration, RSVP tracking, and group management. Address data privacy considerations, guest list export capabilities, and duplicate detection mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rich Text Editor
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Rich Text Editor component focused on content creation and editing capabilities. Document the Tiptap-based implementation, toolbar customization, and content formatting options. Explain the FontSizeControl integration for typography adjustments and the editor's integration with the invitation builder system. Detail the content serialization, validation, and storage mechanisms. Include configuration options for allowed formats, custom extensions, and accessibility features. Provide examples of editor usage within the builder context, content preview integration, and mobile-responsive design considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Approval Request Service
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the approval request service implementation. Thoroughly explain the admin approval workflow including request creation, review processes, and decision handling. Document the service methods for managing approval requests, status tracking, and notification systems. Include concrete examples of approval request lifecycle management, automated workflows, and manual review processes. Explain the integration with admin authentication, role-based access control, and audit logging. Address approval request queuing, batch processing, and escalation mechanisms. Document error handling strategies for approval workflows, notification delivery, and compliance tracking. Provide guidelines for extending approval functionality, customizing approval rules, and maintaining audit trails for administrative oversight.

wiki_catalogs.name: Validation System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the validation system focused on form validation patterns and error handling mechanisms. Explain the validation architecture, rule definitions, and error propagation throughout the form hierarchy. Document the real-time validation feedback, conditional validation rules, and async validation patterns. Detail the error message localization, validation timing strategies, and user experience considerations. Include examples of custom validators, validation chaining, and form-wide validation states. Document the integration with accessibility features, screen reader announcements, and error focus management.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Actions and Mutations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the state mutation functions and action patterns. Document the comprehensive set of setter functions organized by functional areas (basic info, location, theme, gallery, accounts). Explain the functional update patterns using callback functions, partial updates with spread operators, and nested object mutations. Detail the difference between direct setters and functional setters, performance implications, and best practices for state updates. Include practical examples of complex state mutations, batch updates, and conditional state changes. Address state immutability patterns, update optimization strategies, and debugging state changes.

wiki_catalogs.name: TimePicker Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the TimePicker component focused on time selection and clock interface implementation. Document the component's props including value, onChange, stepInterval, and 12/24-hour format settings. Explain the time selection interface, minute intervals handling, and format conversion logic. Detail the responsive time picker layout, touch-friendly controls, and keyboard navigation support. Include examples of time range selection, validation rules, and integration with date pickers. Document accessibility features including ARIA labels, screen reader announcements, and keyboard shortcuts. Address localization support, performance considerations for time calculations, and customization options for styling and behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Gallery View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the GalleryView component focused on the photo gallery section rendering. Explain the responsive grid system, image carousel functionality, and lightbox modal implementation. Document the image loading strategies, lazy loading techniques, and performance optimizations for multiple images. Detail the gallery layout modes, thumbnail generation, and touch/swipe gesture handling for mobile devices. Include practical examples of image processing, fallback image handling, and the integration with the builder's image uploader. Address accessibility features including keyboard navigation, ARIA labels, and screen reader support. Document the relationship with the builder's gallery section and state synchronization patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Location Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Location Section component and its content subcomponent. Explain the location input system, map integration, and venue information handling. Document the LocationSectionContent component's role in rendering location displays and the main LocationSection's form handling. Include examples of map SDK integration, address validation, and location sharing features. Detail the component architecture, prop interfaces, and user interaction patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the authentication system focused on NextAuth.js integration with Supabase backend. Explain the OAuth provider configuration including Kakao and Naver authentication flows. Document session management, user profile synchronization, and token handling mechanisms. Detail the edge runtime authentication implementation and server-side session validation. Include practical examples of authentication guards, protected routes, and user state management. Document the integration between NextAuth.js and Supabase database for user data persistence. Address security considerations including session security, CSRF protection, and authentication middleware. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common authentication issues and testing strategies for authentication flows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Architecture Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the architecture overview section focused on the high-level system design of the Banana Wedding platform. Document the frontend architecture using Next.js App Router with server components, client components, and server actions. Explain the backend architecture with Supabase integration, database design with Row Level Security, and API layer implementation. Detail the state management architecture using Zustand store with persistence, and the component architecture following atomic design principles. Cover the authentication architecture with NextAuth.js integration, session management, and role-based access control. Include data flow patterns, component relationships, and architectural patterns used throughout the platform. Provide system diagrams showing major components and their interactions. Address scalability considerations, performance optimization strategies, and deployment architecture.

wiki_catalogs.name: Section Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the section components system focused on the modular invitation building blocks. Explain the section architecture with specialized components for different invitation elements. Document each section type including BasicInfoSection, DateTimeSection, LocationSection, GallerySection, ThemeSection, MainScreenSection, GreetingSection, ClosingSection, and AccountsSection. Detail the component structure, prop interfaces, state management, and rendering logic. Include examples of section customization, dynamic content updates, and integration patterns. Document the section lifecycle, validation requirements, and performance considerations. Address the relationship between sections and the overall invitation structure.

wiki_catalogs.name: Effects Overlay
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for the effects overlay system focused on visual enhancement and theme-based effects rendering. Explain how the EffectsOverlay component applies animated backgrounds, pattern overlays, and special effects to the invitation canvas. Document the effect types (rain, snow, confetti), animation timing, and performance considerations for continuous animations. Detail the integration with theme properties, conditional effect rendering, and the relationship between overlay effects and overall invitation aesthetics. Include practical examples of effect customization, performance optimization for animations, and troubleshooting common overlay rendering issues. Address the CSS-in-JS approach used for dynamic effect styling and the coordination with theme system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security Considerations
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for authentication security considerations in the system. Document CSRF protection mechanisms, session security headers, and secure cookie configuration. Explain middleware implementation for authentication enforcement and route protection. Detail token security practices, session timeout configuration, and logout handling. Include practical examples of implementing authentication middleware, protecting API routes, and securing sensitive operations. Document security best practices for OAuth implementation, including state parameter validation and PKCE usage. Address common security vulnerabilities in authentication flows and their mitigation strategies. Provide guidance on monitoring authentication attempts, rate limiting, and suspicious activity detection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Supabase Client Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for Supabase client configuration focused on database connectivity and client-side implementation. Document the different client configurations including server-side database access, client-side database operations, and admin database client. Explain the authentication mechanisms, connection pooling, and security considerations for each client type. Detail the configuration options, environment variables, and best practices for database connectivity. Include practical examples of database operations using different client configurations, error handling strategies, and performance optimization techniques. Document the relationship between client configuration and the application's security model.

wiki_catalogs.name: Profile Services
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the profile management endpoints. Document the GET /api/profiles endpoint for retrieving user profiles with authentication context. Detail the PUT /api/profiles endpoint for updating profile information including personal details, preferences, and account settings. Cover the POST /api/profiles endpoint for profile completion during first-time user setup. Include request/response schemas for profile data, validation rules for required fields, and profile picture upload handling. Document profile visibility settings, privacy controls, and data protection measures. Provide examples of profile updates, verification workflows, and profile completion status tracking. Address profile synchronization across devices and account linking capabilities.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Primitive Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the UI primitive components built on Radix UI primitives. Detail the Button component with variants and states, Input field styling and validation, Dialog for modal interactions, DropdownMenu for contextual actions, Tabs for content organization, Sheet for slide-out panels, Alert and InfoMessage for user feedback, and Sonner for toast notifications. Explain the Radix UI integration patterns, accessibility compliance, and design token usage. Document component APIs, styling approaches, animation behaviors, and integration patterns. Include examples of component composition, theming customization, and responsive design implementation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Server Actions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the server actions implementation pattern. Thoroughly explain the Next.js server actions architecture, form submission handling, and secure data mutation patterns. Document the action functions for invitation management, profile updates, and approval operations. Include concrete examples of server action composition, error boundary handling, and client-server communication. Explain the integration with Supabase for database operations, authentication validation, and real-time updates. Address security considerations including input sanitization, CSRF protection, and authorization checks. Document performance optimization techniques, caching strategies, and progressive enhancement patterns. Provide guidelines for creating reusable action patterns, handling complex workflows, and maintaining type safety across client-server boundaries.

wiki_catalogs.name: Responsive Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the responsive design implementation focused on adaptive form layouts and mobile optimization. Explain the breakpoint strategies, flexible grid systems, and component scaling patterns. Document the mobile-first approach, touch-friendly interactions, and viewport adaptation techniques. Detail the modal responsiveness, select component adaptations, and layout reflow mechanisms. Include examples of responsive form sections, adaptive validation displays, and mobile-specific UX patterns. Document the CSS-in-JS integration, media query patterns, and performance considerations for different device classes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Real-time Subscriptions and Collaboration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the real-time subscription system and collaborative editing features. Explain the client-subscriptions architecture for live data synchronization, subscription lifecycle management, and conflict resolution strategies. Document the integration between local state and remote database updates, optimistic updates, and rollback mechanisms. Detail the subscription patterns for different data types, performance optimization for concurrent updates, and error handling for network failures. Include practical examples of subscription setup, data synchronization workflows, and collaborative editing scenarios. Address subscription cleanup, memory management, and debugging collaborative state issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: ResponsiveSelect Component
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for the ResponsiveSelect component focused on dropdown selection with adaptive design. Document the component's props including options array, value, onChange, placeholder, and size variants. Explain the dropdown interface implementation, option filtering, and keyboard navigation patterns. Detail the responsive behavior across different screen sizes, mobile optimization strategies, and touch interaction handling. Include examples of single and multi-select modes, custom option rendering, and async option loading. Document accessibility features including ARIA attributes, screen reader support, and keyboard-only navigation. Address performance optimizations for large option lists, search functionality, and customization options for styling and behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Calendar Section View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the CalendarSectionView component focused on the date and time display section. Explain the calendar rendering system, date formatting logic, and timezone handling. Document the event display functionality, date validation, and integration with the invitation's date/time settings. Detail the responsive calendar layout, mobile-friendly date pickers, and accessibility features for date selection. Include practical examples of date formatting for different locales, conditional event display, and the integration with the builder's date/time configuration. Address internationalization support, date range validation, and the relationship with the invitation's scheduling system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Gallery Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Gallery Section component and its content subcomponent. Explain the image upload system, gallery layout rendering, and responsive image handling. Document the GallerySectionContent component's role in displaying galleries and the main GallerySection's management of image collections. Include examples of drag-and-drop functionality, image optimization, and mobile gallery experiences. Detail the component's integration with cloud storage and performance considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Invitation Builder System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the invitation builder system focused on the real-time invitation creation interface. Explain the builder page architecture, section-based editing approach, and live preview functionality. Document the state management system using Zustand store with IndexedDB persistence and URL-based mode differentiation. Detail the real-time preview system and how changes propagate from form inputs to visual representation. Include practical examples of section editing workflows, state synchronization patterns, and performance optimization techniques. Document the modular section system allowing for extensible invitation components. Address user experience considerations including mobile-first design, responsive editing interface, and collaborative editing capabilities.

wiki_catalogs.name: Real-time Preview System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the real-time preview system focused on the dynamic invitation rendering engine. Explain the preview architecture with InvitationCanvas component, section rendering, and mobile simulation features. Document the preview modes (desktop/mobile), responsive scaling, and performance optimization techniques. Detail the rendering pipeline from store state to visual output, including component composition and layout calculations. Include examples of preview customization, animation handling, and interactive elements. Document the integration with the builder interface, real-time updates, and collaborative editing features. Address preview debugging, performance monitoring, and cross-platform compatibility.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the authentication system endpoints. Document the GET /api/auth/[...nextauth] endpoint for NextAuth.js integration with OAuth provider callbacks and session management. Detail the GET /api/auth/naver/callback endpoint for Naver OAuth authentication flow and user profile retrieval. Cover the POST /api/auth/logout endpoint for session termination and cookie clearing. Include request/response schemas for authentication tokens, user session data, and provider-specific parameters. Document OAuth flow patterns, state management, and CSRF protection. Provide examples of successful authentication, error handling for failed logins, and session refresh mechanisms. Address security considerations, token expiration handling, and multi-provider authentication support.

wiki_catalogs.name: Checkbox and Switch Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for Checkbox and Switch components focused on boolean input handling and toggle controls. Document the props for both components including checked, onChange, label, disabled state, and size variations. Explain the visual design patterns, animation implementations, and state management approaches. Detail the accessibility features including ARIA attributes, keyboard interaction, and screen reader support. Include examples of indeterminate states, grouped checkboxes, and switch positioning. Document the responsive design implementations, touch target sizing for mobile devices, and cross-platform consistency. Address form integration patterns, validation handling, and customization options for styling and behavior.

wiki_catalogs.name: Location View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the LocationView component focused on the venue and location display section. Explain the map integration system, location search functionality, and directions rendering. Document the multiple map provider support (Kakao, Naver), map customization options, and fallback mechanisms for map loading failures. Detail the location details display, address formatting, and integration with the invitation's location settings. Include practical examples of map initialization, marker placement, and responsive map sizing. Address accessibility features for location information, offline map handling, and the relationship with the builder's location configuration. Document the integration with location services and geocoding functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: Theme Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Theme Section component. Explain the theme selection system, color customization options, and design template management. Document the component's integration with the preview system and how theme changes propagate throughout the invitation. Include examples of theme switching, color palette generation, and design consistency enforcement. Detail the component's state management, validation logic, and user experience patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Preview System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the preview system focused on the real-time invitation rendering engine. Explain the InvitationCanvas architecture and how it translates builder state into responsive mobile previews. Document the section rendering system and how individual components are composed into a cohesive invitation layout. Detail the mobile preview simulation including device frame rendering and responsive breakpoint handling. Include practical examples of preview customization, performance optimization for large canvases, and export functionality. Document the relationship between builder state and preview rendering, including how real-time updates are handled. Address technical considerations such as canvas optimization, image handling, and cross-browser compatibility for preview rendering.

wiki_catalogs.name: Supabase Token Generation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Supabase token generation endpoint. Document the POST /api/supabase/token endpoint for generating temporary client tokens for secure database access. Detail the request parameters including user authentication context, requested permissions, and token expiration settings. Cover the response format containing JWT tokens, expiration timestamps, and scope limitations. Include security considerations for token issuance, revocation mechanisms, and rotation policies. Document the integration with Supabase authentication, Row Level Security enforcement, and client-side token storage. Provide examples of token generation workflows, error scenarios for unauthorized access, and token validation processes. Address token lifetime management, automatic refresh mechanisms, and security best practices for client-side database access.

wiki_catalogs.name: Accounts View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AccountsView component focused on the account and contact information display section. Explain the account information rendering system, contact method display, and social media integration. Document the responsive layout for account details, contact button functionality, and integration with the invitation's account settings. Detail the fallback mechanisms for missing account information, accessibility considerations for contact details, and the styling system for different account types. Include practical examples of account data processing, conditional display based on account presence, and the integration with the builder's accounts configuration. Address privacy considerations for contact information display and the relationship with user authentication systems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Main Screen Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Main Screen Section component and its content subcomponent. Explain the hero image handling, main screen customization, and responsive design implementation. Document the MainScreenSectionContent component's role in rendering the primary invitation display and the main component's management of screen layouts. Include examples of image optimization, background effects, and mobile-first design patterns. Detail the component's integration with the preview system and performance considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the state management system focused on Zustand implementation and data synchronization. Explain the useInvitationStore architecture including state structure, actions, and middleware integration. Document the IndexedDB persistence strategy and how it maintains state across browser sessions. Detail the client subscription system for real-time data synchronization and collaborative features. Include practical examples of state updates, selector patterns, and performance optimization techniques. Document the URL-based mode differentiation system for edit vs create workflows. Address state hydration, error handling, and debugging strategies for complex state management scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Closing View
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the ClosingView component focused on the closing message and signature section. Explain the rich text processing for closing messages, HTML content rendering, and dynamic content injection. Document the signature display system, typography scaling, and integration with the invitation's theme colors and fonts. Detail the responsive layout for closing content, fallback mechanisms for empty messages, and accessibility considerations for screen readers. Include practical examples of message processing, conditional rendering based on content presence, and the styling system using CSS modules. Address performance considerations for HTML rendering and content optimization techniques for the closing section.

wiki_catalogs.name: Greeting Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Greeting Section component. Explain the greeting text editing system, rich text formatting, and content customization options. Document the component's integration with the rich text editor and how greeting content appears in the final invitation. Include examples of text formatting, character limits, and multilingual support. Detail the component's state management, validation logic, and user experience patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the database architecture focused on Supabase implementation and data modeling. Explain the database schema design including tables for invitations, profiles, guests, and approval requests. Document the Row Level Security (RLS) policies and access control mechanisms. Detail the migration management system and how schema changes are applied to production environments. Include practical examples of database queries, relationship patterns, and data integrity constraints. Document the Supabase client configuration for server-side and client-side database access. Address performance considerations including indexing strategies, query optimization, and caching patterns. Provide troubleshooting guidance for database connectivity issues and migration failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Closing Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Closing Section component. Explain the closing message system, final remarks handling, and signature display options. Document the component's integration with the overall invitation flow and how closing content contributes to the invitation's completion. Include examples of message formatting, personalization options, and responsive display patterns. Detail the component's state management and user interaction patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Endpoints
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the RESTful API endpoints used throughout the Banana Wedding platform. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for each endpoint group. Include admin invitation management endpoints for approval workflows, guest management APIs for RSVP tracking, and profile services for user data. Detail the approval request handling system and how admin workflows are processed. Document the Supabase token generation endpoint for secure client authentication. Provide practical examples of API usage, error handling strategies, and rate limiting considerations. Include authentication methods, parameter validation, and response formatting standards. Address API versioning, backward compatibility, and deprecation policies where applicable.

wiki_catalogs.name: Accounts Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Accounts Section component. Explain the account management system, user account linking, and invitation access controls. Document the component's role in managing who can view and edit invitations. Include examples of account permissions, sharing mechanisms, and collaborative editing features. Detail the component's integration with the authentication system and security considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Social Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the social integration system focused on KakaoTalk sharing and Naver authentication. Explain the Kakao SDK integration for social sharing functionality including thumbnail generation and share dialog management. Document the Naver OAuth implementation and how it integrates with the authentication system. Detail the mobile sharing experience and how invitations are optimized for social platforms. Include practical examples of share configuration, custom message templates, and analytics tracking. Document the SDK loader pattern and how external dependencies are managed. Address cross-platform compatibility, fallback mechanisms, and performance optimization for social features. Provide troubleshooting guidance for SDK initialization issues and sharing permission problems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Social Sharing Section
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Social Sharing Section components. Explain the KakaoTalk sharing integration, SDK loading mechanism, and social media sharing capabilities. Document the KakaoSdkLoader component's role in managing external SDK dependencies and the KakaoShareSection's implementation of share functionality. Include examples of sharing triggers, content preparation, and user experience patterns. Detail the component's integration with social media APIs and error handling strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the UI component system focused on the atomic design implementation and design system integration. Explain the component hierarchy from atoms to organisms and how they follow TDS Mobile design system principles. Document the Radix UI primitives foundation and SCSS modules styling approach. Detail the common component library including form components, layout elements, and interactive widgets. Include practical examples of component usage, prop interfaces, and customization options. Document the responsive design system and how components adapt across device sizes. Address accessibility compliance with WCAG guidelines and keyboard navigation support. Provide guidelines for component development, testing strategies, and maintenance patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the styling system focused on SCSS architecture and design token implementation. Explain the modular SCSS approach using BEM methodology and CSS modules for component isolation. Document the design token system including color palettes, typography scales, spacing units, and animation variables. Detail the responsive design implementation with mobile-first breakpoints and adaptive layouts. Include practical examples of component styling, theme customization, and dark mode support. Document the integration with Radix UI design system and how custom styles complement primitive components. Address performance considerations including CSS optimization, critical path styling, and bundle size management. Provide guidelines for maintaining design consistency and extending the styling system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Services Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the services layer focused on business logic implementation and data access patterns. Explain the service architecture including invitation service, profile service, and approval request service implementations. Document the server actions pattern and how they handle data mutations securely. Detail the utility services and helper functions that support core business operations. Include practical examples of service composition, error handling strategies, and transaction management. Document the integration between services and database clients, including query optimization and caching strategies. Address service testing patterns, mocking strategies, and performance monitoring. Provide guidelines for extending the services layer and maintaining clean separation of concerns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Hooks and Utilities
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the hooks and utilities system focused on custom React hooks and helper functions. Explain the custom hook collection including useAuth, useMediaQuery, useToast, and useWindowSize implementations. Document the utility functions for formatting, image processing, and data manipulation. Detail the TypeScript type definitions and how they support type safety across the application. Include practical examples of hook usage, utility function applications, and type definition patterns. Document the accessibility hooks and how they support WCAG compliance. Address performance optimization techniques including memoization patterns and dependency management. Provide guidelines for creating new hooks and utilities while maintaining consistency with existing patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Testing Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the testing strategy focused on unit testing, integration testing, and accessibility testing implementation. Explain the Vitest configuration and testing environment setup. Document the testing patterns for React components, hooks, and services. Detail the accessibility testing approach using axe-core and WCAG compliance verification. Include practical examples of test writing, mock strategies, and test utilities. Document the testing utilities and helper functions for component testing. Address continuous integration testing, test coverage requirements, and performance testing strategies. Provide guidelines for writing effective tests, maintaining test suites, and debugging test failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment and DevOps
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for deployment and DevOps focused on build configuration and production deployment strategies. Explain the Next.js build configuration including static generation, serverless functions, and performance optimizations. Document the middleware implementation for request processing and security enforcement. Detail the deployment pipeline including Vercel deployment, environment configuration, and CI/CD integration. Include practical examples of build optimization, bundle analysis, and performance monitoring. Document the environment variable management and secrets handling for different deployment stages. Address monitoring strategies, error tracking, and performance optimization in production. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common deployment issues and rollback procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Contributing Guidelines
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for contributing guidelines focused on development workflow and code contribution standards. Explain the code conventions including naming patterns, file organization, and architectural principles. Document the pull request process including branch naming, commit conventions, and code review standards. Detail the development workflow from feature branching to merge procedures. Include practical examples of code formatting, testing requirements, and documentation standards. Document the commit message conventions including feat:, fix:, docs:, refactor:, test:, chore: patterns. Address code quality standards, peer review processes, and maintainer responsibilities. Provide guidelines for reporting issues, feature requests, and community collaboration.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>

# Banana Wedding - Wedding Invitation Platform

## Project Introduction

**Purpose Statement**
Banana Wedding is a modern, mobile-first wedding invitation platform that enables couples to create personalized digital invitations with advanced customization capabilities. The platform focuses on providing an intuitive builder experience with real-time preview functionality and seamless social sharing integration.

**Core Goals and Objectives**
- Deliver a premium mobile invitation experience with responsive design
- Provide comprehensive customization tools for wedding themes, layouts, and content
- Enable seamless social media integration (KakaoTalk, Naver)
- Ensure accessibility compliance with WCAG guidelines
- Maintain high performance through optimized architecture and caching strategies

**Target Audience**
- Modern couples planning weddings who prefer digital invitations
- Users seeking customizable, shareable wedding experiences
- Tech-savvy individuals who appreciate mobile-first design

## Technical Architecture

The project follows a modern Next.js 16 architecture with App Router, implementing strict data fetching patterns and server-side rendering optimization.

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Client Browser] --> B[Next.js App Router]
    B --> C[Middleware Authentication]
    B --> D[Server Components]
    D --> E[Supabase Database]
    D --> F[Server Actions]
    F --> E
    B --> G[Static Assets]
    G --> H[CDN Distribution]
    
    subgraph "Authentication Layer"
        C --> I[NextAuth.js]
        I --> J[Supabase Adapter]
    end
    
    subgraph "State Management"
        K[Zustand Store] --> L[IndexedDB Persistence]
        K --> M[Global State]
    end
    
    subgraph "UI Components"
        N[Builder Components] --> O[Preview Canvas]
        N --> P[Form Editors]
        O --> Q[Dynamic Sections]
    end
```

### Component Breakdown

**Frontend Architecture**
- **App Router**: Implements strict data fetching patterns with server components
- **Component Hierarchy**: Atomic design system with UI primitives, common components, and feature-specific organisms
- **State Management**: Centralized Zustand store with IndexedDB persistence for offline capability
- **Styling**: SCSS modules with design tokens and Radix UI primitives

**Backend Integration**
- **Database**: Supabase PostgreSQL with RLS policies and Row Level Security
- **Authentication**: NextAuth.js with Supabase adapter supporting multiple providers
- **File Storage**: Supabase Storage for media assets and user uploads
- **Real-time**: Supabase Realtime for collaborative features

### Design Patterns

**Data Flow Pattern**
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
    participant U as User
    participant B as Builder Page
    participant S as Zustand Store
    participant V as Invitation Canvas
    participant D as Supabase
    
    U->>B: Edit Content
    B->>S: Update State
    S->>V: Trigger Re-render
    V->>D: Save to Database
    D-->>V: Confirm Save
    V-->>U: Show Success
```

**Component Architecture Pattern**
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Atomic UI Components] --> B[Common Components]
    B --> C[Builder Organisms]
    C --> D[Preview Components]
    D --> E[Section Views]
    
    subgraph "Layered Architecture"
        F[UI Primitives] --> G[Common Components]
        G --> H[Feature Components]
    end
```

## Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points

**Application Bootstrap**
- [`src/app/layout.tsx`](src/app/layout.tsx): Root layout with metadata, fonts, and providers
- [`src/app/page.tsx`](src/app/page.tsx): Landing page with hero section and call-to-action
- [`src/app/builder/page.tsx`](src/app/builder/page.tsx): Main builder interface with real-time preview

**State Management**
- [`src/store/useInvitationStore.ts`](src/store/useInvitationStore.ts): Centralized state with IndexedDB persistence
- [`src/components/preview/InvitationCanvas.tsx`](src/components/preview/InvitationCanvas.tsx): Dynamic preview rendering system

### Core Modules

**Authentication System**
- [`src/auth-edge.ts`](src/auth-edge.ts): Edge runtime authentication wrapper
- [`src/auth-config.ts`](src/auth-config.ts): NextAuth.js configuration with multiple providers
- [`src/lib/supabase/client.ts`](src/lib/supabase/client.ts): Supabase client initialization and token management

**Data Services**
- [`src/services/invitationService.ts`](src/services/invitationService.ts): CRUD operations for invitation data
- [`src/lib/supabaseAdmin.ts`](src/lib/supabaseAdmin.ts): Admin-level database access with service role

**API Routes**
- [`src/app/api/admin/invitations/[id]/route.ts`](src/app/api/admin/invitations/[id]/route.ts): Admin-only invitation management
- [`src/app/api/supabase/token/route.ts`](src/app/api/supabase/token/route.ts): Token generation for client authentication

### Configuration Approach

**Build Configuration**
- [`next.config.ts`](next.config.ts): Comprehensive Next.js configuration with PWA support and security headers
- [`package.json`](package.json): Dependencies including React 19, Next.js 16, and modern UI libraries

**Database Schema**
- [`supabase/config.toml`](supabase/config.toml): Supabase configuration with multi-schema support
- [`supabase/migrations/`](supabase/migrations/): Version-controlled database schema evolution

### External Dependencies

**Core Framework Dependencies**
- React 19 with concurrent features and automatic batching
- Next.js 16 with App Router and server actions
- TypeScript 5 with strict type checking

**UI and Styling**
- Radix UI primitives for accessible component foundation
- SCSS modules for component-scoped styling
- Lucide React for consistent iconography

**State Management**
- Zustand for lightweight state management with persistence
- IDB-Keyval for IndexedDB integration

**Database and Authentication**
- Supabase for backend-as-a-service with real-time capabilities
- NextAuth.js for flexible authentication strategies

### Integration Points

**Third-party Services**
```mermaid
graph LR
    A[Banana Wedding] --> B[Kakao Maps SDK]
    A --> C[Naver Maps SDK]
    A --> D[KakaoTalk Share]
    A --> E[Social Login Providers]
    A --> F[Supabase Storage]
    
    subgraph "External APIs"
        B --> G[Geocoding]
        C --> H[Map Rendering]
        D --> I[Social Sharing]
        E --> J[OAuth Flows]
        F --> K[Media Storage]
    end
```

**Middleware Integration**
- [`middleware.ts`](middleware.ts): Authentication guard for protected routes
- [`src/hooks/useAuth.ts`](src/hooks/useAuth.ts): Client-side authentication state management

## Key Features

### Functionality Overview

**Real-time Builder Experience**
- Live preview with mobile-first design simulation
- Drag-and-drop section management with visual feedback
- Instant theme application across all components
- Responsive design validation during creation

**Advanced Customization**
- Multiple font families with Korean typography support
- Theme-based color systems with accessibility compliance
- Gallery management with swiper integration
- Location integration with multiple map providers

**Social Integration**
- KakaoTalk sharing with rich media previews
- Naver and Kakao OAuth authentication
- Mobile-optimized sharing experience

### Implementation Highlights

**Performance Optimization**
- [`src/app/builder/BuilderPage.module.scss`](src/app/builder/BuilderPage.module.scss): Optimized layout with lazy loading
- [`src/components/preview/InvitationCanvas.tsx`](src/components/preview/InvitationCanvas.tsx): Dynamic imports for heavy components
- [`src/lib/supabase/client.ts`](src/lib/supabase/client.ts): Token caching and efficient client initialization

**Accessibility Features**
- [`src/styles/_accessibility.scss`](src/styles/_accessibility.scss): WCAG-compliant color contrast and keyboard navigation
- [`src/hooks/useAccessibility.tsx`](src/hooks/useAccessibility.tsx): Dynamic accessibility adjustments
- Comprehensive ARIA labeling throughout component hierarchy

**State Management Architecture**
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Uninitialized
    Uninitialized --> Ready: Initialize Store
    Ready --> Editing: User Interaction
    Editing --> Saving: Save Request
    Saving --> Saved: Success
    Saving --> Error: Failure
    Saved --> Editing: Continue Editing
    Error --> Editing: Retry
    Ready --> [*]: Cleanup
```

### Feature Architecture

**Component Relationship Diagram**
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[BuilderPage] --> B[Header Component]
    A --> C[EditorForm]
    A --> D[InvitationCanvas]
    
    C --> E[Section Editors]
    E --> F[BasicInfoSection]
    E --> G[DateTimeSection]
    E --> H[LocationSection]
    E --> I[GallerySection]
    E --> J[ThemeSection]
    
    D --> K[MainScreenView]
    D --> L[GreetingView]
    D --> M[AccountsView]
    D --> N[LocationView]
    D --> O[GalleryView]
    D --> P[ClosingView]
    
    subgraph "State Management"
        Q[Zustand Store] --> R[InvitationData]
        R --> S[UI State]
        R --> T[Theme Settings]
    end
    
    A --> Q
```

**Data Flow Architecture**
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Input] --> B[Form Validation]
    B --> C[State Update]
    C --> D[Store Persistence]
    D --> E[Canvas Re-render]
    E --> F[Database Sync]
    F --> G[Success Feedback]
    
    subgraph "Validation Layer"
        H[Schema Validation] --> I[Format Validation]
        I --> J[Business Logic Validation]
    end
    
    B --> H
    C --> K[Selective Updates]
    K --> L[Optimized Re-renders]
```

---

**Sources:**
- [package.json](package.json)
- [next.config.ts](next.config.ts)
- [src/app/layout.tsx](src/app/layout.tsx)
- [src/app/page.tsx](src/app/page.tsx)
- [src/lib/supabase/client.ts](src/lib/supabase/client.ts)
- [src/app/api/admin/invitations/[id]/route.ts](src/app/api/admin/invitations/[id]/route.ts)
- [src/app/builder/page.tsx](src/app/builder/page.tsx)
- [src/store/useInvitationStore.ts](src/store/useInvitationStore.ts)
- [src/services/invitationService.ts](src/services/invitationService.ts)
- [src/components/preview/InvitationCanvas.tsx](src/components/preview/InvitationCanvas.tsx)
- [middleware.ts](middleware.ts)
- [src/auth-edge.ts](src/auth-edge.ts)
- [src/auth-config.ts](src/auth-config.ts)
- [supabase/config.toml](supabase/config.toml)
- [ARCHITECTURE.md](ARCHITECTURE.md)

</blog>
